text: DEFINING ABNORMALITY L 8 N L Statistical Approach * Not all rare behavior is disordered (running marathons) and not all disordered behavior is all that rare (drinking heavily) Impairment Approach = Often psychological disorders interfere with life in enough ways to cause some kind of impairment, but people may not always find this to be the case (manic episodes) Deviance Approach * Not all socially deviant behavior is disordered = Over time what is acceptable in society often changes (homosexuality in the US) * This standard is also very subjective Subjective Distress Approach * Whether a person experiences distress as a consequence of abnormal behavior often depends on how that person is treated by the people around him/her. * This standard may not be as easily applied in cultures that discourage the outward expression of distress.
